review: another fantastic remaster from nightdive

its fun as in the old day i like the old school in feeling and soundnice timetravel back in time when this was magic makes an old gamer happy  decided to go with mk instead of controller and everything is smooth happy times
story goodish good game for its time worth playing for the nostalgia
an oldie but a goody love seeing the remastered version
great little game to play dont expect an immaculate story just a fun shooter to turn your brain off to and feel nostalgia

fun game i played it a little bit back in the day when it came out but i never beat it so i was excited to try out the remastered version overall i liked it i got a little annoyed at some of the puzzles but i guess they werent too difficult to understand  not sure if ill ever play this again but im glad i finally beat it
addicting game
just like mom used to make
get it on sale a must have for any star wars fan 910 could do with less labyrinthine level design but its still great
overpriced banger
very good remaster

fantastic remaster of a fantastic game next to star wars tie fighter this is one of the best star wars games ever it exists somewhere in between the doom engine and build engine in terms of interactivity with some really cool facsimiles of star wars locations its nice that they got the avenger demo level functional and included that
same game just looks better on newer hardware so if you liked it before you will like it better now
excellent classic shooter
make me feel like a real star war
good game now remaster dark forces 2 please

decent buy on sale worth about 2025 aud way better than the original the controls hud crosshair gunplay enemies etc was super fast and smooth can be tricky at times puzzles are odd horrible jankiness reduced now from og mind the respawn glitch sometimes game does not seem to have in mission checkpointssaves you have to complete each mission at a time etc 810

same game i loved playing as a kid but far easier than i remember it being looks great but very short play it on hard for the best challenge possible unlocking achievements is a joke its just playing through the game to obtain them star wars themed doom but fun anyway
really fun good remaster took me about 4 hours to beat

a faithful remaster of the original also thanks to the fan community for the engine upgrades  a unique a fun legacy take on star wars fps gameplay with a focus on puzzle solving almost as much as general fps shooting aspect

i appreciate that nightdive did a good job modernising this game but honestly i didnt really enjoy it the level design is complete  the music is also complete  running into unavoidable mines gets old very fast kind of regret paying the current price for this even with a 45 off sale  i give it a thumbs up purely because i respect nightdives effort
19952025its about time to finish this masterpieceagain
love revisiting this game but forgot how damn painful the no save system iseven on easy other than thatbring back so many memories of skipping work so i could get to the next level
star wars mod for doom 2

honestly a rock solid port of this game for pc the graphics are smoothed out enough that its not murder on the eyes like the dos version but at the same time preserves the nostalgia in the visuals the controller support is pretty solid and i was able to complete the entire game with an xbox controller i would recommend the medium difficulty for players familiar with fps games of this era
very fun good remaster

great classic doomlike fun weapons and puzzle maps with bonus star wars the remaster makes it absolutely lovely to play in this day and age while taking you back to the feel of the original 1995 release its a small game you can get all the story and achievements in about 11 hours still very worth it
yes
the force is strong with this remaster
great remaster

a great fast paced fun star wars game from the golden age of star wars games the remaster does a great job at keeping the original feel and aesthetics of dark forces while still giving it a brand new look for the modern era   the jabbas ship mission on hard difficulty is the only mission i hated the most that made playing on hard less enjoyable who thought it was a good idea to have 5 krell dragons in one small room
a very fun classic game doom style gameplay with star wars into the mix def a fun combo glad i got the chance to play this i recommend trying this game out
it plays like doom looks like star wars what else do you want
this is how remasters should be provides modern updates but still captures the soul of this classic
great remaster of a classic and only takes about 6 ish hours to complete
great remaster of a classic only takes about 68 hours to complete no achievements for getting secrets or collectibles just play the game to the end

as someone who isnt that big of a star wars fan and played this because its similar to doom i was pleasantly surprised on how decent this game is it may have even gotten me into the star wars movies 710

its a great port faithful to the original and much smoother framerate with modern gamepad controls even a weapon wheel for easy selection enjoy the pixel art puzzles and the original star wars expanded universe as we wished the sequel trilogy could have been
good nostalgic game not worth 30 though
one of the best classic shooters of the era complex levels and unique weapons make this one stand out to me

never heard this existed till civvie 11 covered it years ago but since there was a remaster in the works this is a great game a bit clunky in movement at times confusing layoutgame play but still a good game
retro games are some of the best where graphics fail gameplay prevails thank you nightdive please do return to castle wolfenstein next
i wanna see a doom 2016level reboot for this series like i wanna see kyle katarn glorykilling stormtroopers
another very well done rerelease of a classic shooter from nightdive i was most won over by the redone prerendered cutscenes
a very worthy remaster its fun to play and the graphics are neat   but the only sad thing is theres no quicksavequickload option
the first star wars fps that introduced the dark troopers it is nothing but fantastic
a great remaster of a classic but too expensive for what it is wait for a decent sale
great
goated

as always with nightdive this remaster brings back the feeling of my memory of playing dark forces a brilliant fps that innovated many things during its release and a fantastic higher resolution cleaner and faster trip down memory lane  if youve never played dark forces before and you enjoy fps games and are wiling to overlook a lot of the qol and other advances thatve been made this is a terrific value

amazing remaster of a classic game i played through on hard as i have played the game before and found it really fun the updated cut scenes and upscaled textures and character in the gameplay were amazing i wish i had gotten this game sooner honestly i am really hoping to see dark forces 2 get this treatment well done to the staff that worked on the remaster and the original staff that made a game worth remastering i am very happy with dark force remaster
the game of my childhood waited since 97 to own it
first pc game i played growing up and still has some challenges
i would only recommend if you like achievements if you want the best game experience i would recommend the og modded version this would be the one were nightdive did not deliver
the remaster is not perfect but dark forces is eternal i hope theyll remaster dark forces 2 jedi knight too

this was one of the first pc games i ever owned and i absolutely loved it back in the 90s  nightdive did a solid job with the remaster levels are still utterly confusing like the original half the battle is navigation in this game or exiting the maps lol  kinda wish it was a tad cheaper but on sale the price was okay and im having my fun with it
fabulous just like the original

first off i like the gameplay its basic but enjoyable and who doesnt love shooting stormtroopers some of the puzzles can be hard at times either being fairly simple or giving you a headache trying to solve them  the story is plain and bare with nothing much to it besides the repeated youve got to stop the empire plot type  however i wouldnt recommend paying full price for a game that offers only 35 hours of gameplay so get it on sale or in a bundle

great remaster perfect balance between the old game and a bit of a fresh new look which is difficult the game mechanics are obviously old dont expect clever ia enemies here or complex maps but the game is a gem

its fun replaying this game from my childhood now i realize why as a kid i struggled to get far in this game the puzzles and maps actually can be confusing and challenging at times even if i didnt have the nostalgia factor i think id still enjoy this remaster
nightdive youve done it again
cool game cool sourceport nightdive good
great game and great remaster

hey  this is amazing  fix the ceiling turrets  they look the same as all the other lights in the game and its impossible to not die or spot them at any point before getting hit by them  thanks everyone
the classic doom era star wars fps brought to modern systems

the price is steep get it in a humble bundle or a sale but the game is pretty fun some of the level puzzles can go fuck itself there was a time on level 4 where the path i had to go lead to me dying of fall damage due to a glitch so i spent around 20 minutes looking for the correct path the one elevator puzzle is stupid as fuck too many plasma fire weapons but overall its pretty fun love the feeling of shooting and dodging lasers

this was a fun nostalgic romp through my childhood dark forces has been lovingly remastered with modernized controls but keeps the charm and challenges from the original loved the 90s audio suffered through the 90s level design i highly recommend for any star wars fan im pretty sure i was smiling the entire time i was playing
i like this game lots and i also dislike the jumpy jump parts lots too
interesting storyline that pulls you in and makes you want to keep playing
not a big fan of star wars but a fan of boomer shooter solid game would be better if there was gun variety it goes from red laser to blue laser to green laser games a fucking maze too 710

lovely classic made into a remaster the game builds itself up by difficulty the first 3 missions are ok to do from mission 4 and later on it will get harder and harder and when nearing the 3 or 4 last missions of this game the puzzles make this game annoying but above all i love this next redneck rampage please
a classical game even though the gameplay is short its still very nostalgic to play this
enjoyable game somewhere inbetween doom  quake  i did not experience any technical issues
what an excellent bug free playable update of this retro classic
i wish the remade the second already
lucasarts asked what if doom but star wars

great game agree with some reviews that a couple of levels are frustrating if you like the gameplay of the original dooms or the wolfenstein series you should really enjoy this story is nothing to write home about but at least it has one unlike doom

ive played dark forces many times this remaster is exactly what i want for continued replay value of this game as if id stop playing it regardless i love the option to run it with improved graphics and crosshairs but the original music some people say its not worth the price id easily disagree if youre a diehard like myself isnt that who this is for anyway
wish we had more star wars games like this one  story driven fun that proves you dont need a glow stick to make star wars fun

one of my favorite star wars franchises and it really is a nice glow up nightdive has better remasters out there but you wont be disappointed by this one either i dont mind a dos game but i will prefer more modern hardware where i can get it asking price is a tinge too high so wait for a sale
nostalgia nice to finally go back and complete this now im a somewhat capable adult
the easiest way to play one of the most significant star wars titles of all time easy recommendation on sale

a faithful remaster of the original with all the modern amenities you could expect its quite expensive for what it is though get it on sale
awesome throwback this was my first game on a pc and its better than i imagined it

not for whining bitches and betas also you can easily find the key for 4 so no complaining about the price the remaster is well made it was a joyous experience replaying this gem after more than two decades i give a big fuck yeah
solid remaster  my first time through the game  fun overall with some frustrating level design at times  but glad i played this classic as a fan of jk2 jedi outcast
classic star wars game sure is fun i really hope they remake dark forces 2
i never got far as a kid but i love it now that i get what im doing the puzzles are fun the music and combat is nostalgic all great elements that make up a great game

just as awesome as i remembered it being i was actually not going to buy it because of some people saying it doesnt hold up but im glad i did this game is alot more than just a doom clone classic puzzles that sometimes be obtuse but thats all part of the lucas arts charm

the gameplay has aged incredibly well and the remaster adds a lot of modern comforts  very well done

got it on sale and id say its definitely worth 1999 peak gaming tbh

only if youre a fan of the series otherwise its an old game bro

a long time ago in a galaxy far far away  this franchise wasnt a big stinky turd

a great remaster of a classic star wars game this has pretty much everything you could ask for modernized resolution and graphics with the same classic gameplay music sound etc all of the cutscenes have been been uprezzed and it also includes a vault of concept art and more for longtime fans of the game anyone whos into boomer shooters or star wars should definitely play this
really old school but very fun
